test.enunciado: A backup software heavily uses hard links between files which have not been changed in between two backup runs. Which benefits are realized due to these hard links? (Choose TWO correct answers)

respuestas.a: The backup runs faster because hard links are asynchronous operations, postponing the copy operation to a later point in time
respuestas.b: The backup runs faster because, instead of copying the data of each file, hard links only change file system meta data
respuestas.c: The backup is guaranteed to be unchanged because the hard links point to the same data on disk instead of storing redundant copies
respuestas.d: The old backup can be moved to slow backup media, such as tapes, while still serving as hard link target in new backups.
respuestas.e: The backup consumes less space because the hard links point to the same data on disk instead of storing redundant copies.

test.enunciado: A yum repository can declare sets of related packages. which yum installs all packages belonging to the group admintools?
After a power outage, the XFS filesystem of /dev/sda3 is inconsistent. How can the existing file system errors be fixed?

respuestas.a: By running xfs_repair on the filesystem
respuestas.b: By mounting the file system with the option xfs_repair
respuestas.c: By running xfsck on the filesystem
respuestas.d: By using mount -f to force a mount of the file system
respuestas.e: By runnig xfsadmin repair on the filesystem

test.enunciado: Instead of supplying an explicit device in /etc/fstab for mounting, what other options may be used to identify the intended partition? (Choose TWO correct answers)
The installation of a local Debian package failed due to unsatisfied dependencies. Which of the following comands installs missing dependencies and completes the interrupted package installation?
What are the main diferences between GPT and MBR partition tables regarding maximum number and size of partitions? ( Choose TWO correct answers)

respuestas.a: Both GPT and MBR support up to four primary partitions, each with up to 4096 TB
respuestas.b: MBR can handle partition sizes up to 2.2 TB, whereas GPT supports sizes up to 9.4 ZB
respuestas.c: MBR can handle partition sizes up to 4 TB,whereas GPT supports partition sizes up to 128 ZB
respuestas.d: By default, GPT can manage up to 128 partitions while MBR only supports four primary partitions
respuestas.e: By default, GPT can manage up to 64 partitions while MBR only supports 16 primary partitions

test.enunciado: What can the Logical Volume Manager (LVM) be used for? (Choose THREE correct answers)

respuestas.c: To dynamically create or delete logical volumes
respuestas.e: To dynamically change the size of logical volumes

test.enunciado: What is the purpose of the ldd command?

respuestas.a: It lists which shared libraries a binary needs to run.
respuestas.b: It defines which version of a library should be used by default.
respuestas.c: It runs a binary with an alternate library search path.
respuestas.d: It turns a dynamically linked binary into a static binary.
respuestas.e: It installs and updates installed shared libraries.

test.enunciado: When removing a package on a system using dpkg package management, which dpkg option ensures configuration files are removed as well?
Which defines the network locations from where the Debian package manager downloads software packages?
Which of the following commands lists all currently installed packages when using RPM package management?
Which of the following commands are valid in the GRUB 2 configuration file? ( Choose TWO correct answers)
Which of the following commands installs the GRUB boot files into the currenty active filesystems and the boot loader into the first partition of the first disk?
Which of the following commands sets the SetUID permission on the executable /bin/foo?
Which of the following files are found in the /boot/ file system? (Choose TWO correct answers)
Which of the following Linux filesystems preallocate a fixed number of inodes when creating a new filesystem instead of generating them as needed? (Choose TWO correct answers)
Which of the following setting for umask ensures that new files have the default permissions -rw-r-----?
Which of the following statements are correct when comparing linux containers with traditional virtual machines (e.g. LXC vs KVM)? (Choose THREE correct answers)

respuestas.a: Containers on the same host can use different operating systems as the container hypervisor creates separate kernel execution environments
respuestas.b: Containers are completely decoupled from the host system's physical hardware and can only use emulated virtual hardware devices.
respuestas.c: The guest environmnet for fully virtualized machines is created by a hypervisor which provides virtual an emulated hardware devices
respuestas.d: Containers are a lightweight virtualization method where the kernel controls process isolation and resource management.
respuestas.e: Fully virtualized machines can run any operating system for a specific hardware and can only use emulated virtual machine.

test.enunciado: What directory contains configuration files for additional yum repositories? (Specify the full path to the directory.)

How many fields are in a syntactically correct line of /etc/fstab?
if the gzip compressed tar archive texts.tgz contains the files a.txt and b.txt, which files will be present in the current directory after running gunzip texts.tgz
In a nested directory structure, which find command line option would be used to restrict the command to searching down a particular number of subdirectories?
in Bash, inserting 1>&2 after a command redirects...
Running chmod 640 files.txt as a regular user doesn't update files.txt's permissions. what might be a reason why chmod cannot modify permissions? (Choose TWO correct answers)

respuestas.a: files.txt is owned by another user and a regular user cannot change the permissions of another user's file.
respuestas.b: files.txt has the SetUID bit set which imposes the restriction that only the root user can make changes to the file
respuestas.c: files.txt is a symbolic link whose permissions are a fixed value which can not be changed
respuestas.d: files.txt has the sticky bit set and regular user cannot remove this permission
respuestas.e: files.txt is a hard link whose permissions are inherited from the target and cannot be set directly

respuestas.a: it only outputs non matching lines
respuestas.b: it changes the output order showing the last matching line first
respuestas.c: it enables color to highlight matching parts
respuestas.d: it shows the command's version information
respuestas.e: it outputs all lines and prefixes maching lines with a +

Given the following two symbolic links in a System V init configuration
/etc/rc1.d/K01apache2
/etc/rc2.d/S02apache2
When are the scripts executed that are referenced by these links? (Choose TWO correct answers)

respuestas.a: K01apache2 is never run because k indicates a deactivated service
respuestas.b: S02apache2 is run when runlevel 2 is entered
respuestas.c: S02apache2 is run when runlevel 2 is left
respuestas.d: K01apache2 is run when runlevel 1 is entered
respuestas.e: Both S02apache2 and K01apache2 are run during a system shutdown

test.enunciado: In the vi editor, how can commands such as moving the cursor or copying lines into the buffer be issued multiple times or applied to multiple rows?

respuestas.a: By specifying the number after a command such as 14 or yj2 followed by escape
respuestas.b: By issuing a command such as :set repetition=4 which repeats everysubsequent command 4 times
respuestas.c: By specifying the number right in front of a command such as 41 or 2yj
respuestas.d: By slecting all affected lines using the shift and cursor keys beforeapplying the command
respuestas.e: By using the command : repeat followed by the nUmber and command

What is the output when the regular espression s/[ABC][abc]/xx/ is applied to the following string? ABCabc
What is the purpose of the xargs command?

respuestas.a: It passes arguments to an X server
respuestas.b: It asks a question, graphically, and returns the answer to the shell
respuestas.c: It allows specifying long options (like --help) for commnads that normally only accept short options(like -h)
respuestas.d: It reads standard input and builds up commands to execute
respuestas.e: It repeats the execution of a command using different parameters for each invocation

test.enunciado: When booting from the hard disk, a computer successfully loads the linux kernel and initramfs but hangs during the subsequent startup tasks. The system is booted using a linux based rescue CD to investigate the problem. Which of the following methods helps to identify the root cause of the problem?

respuestas.a: Using the dmesg command from the rescue CD's shell to view the original system's boot logs
respuestas.b: Investigating the file /var/log on the computer's hard disk for possible errors.
respuestas.c: Using chroot to switch to the file system on the hard disk and use dmesg to view the logs
respuestas.d: Rebooting again from the hard drive since the system successfully booted from the rescue CD
respuestas.e: Investigating the file /proc/kmsg on the computer's hard disk for possible errors

Which of the following statements are correct about the initial RAM disk involved in the boot process of Linux? ( Choose TWO correct answers)

respuestas.a: An initramfs does not depend on a specific kernel version and is not changed after the installation
respuestas.b: After a successful boot, the initramfs contents are available in /run/initramfs/
respuestas.c: An initramfs file contains the MBR, the booloader and the Linux kernel
respuestas.d: An initramfs is a compressed file system archive, which can be unpacked to examine its contents
respuestas.e: The kernel uses the initramfs temporarily before accessing the real root file system

test.enunciado: Which of the following statements is correct for a command ending with an & character?

respuestas.a: The command's is run as a direct child of the init process
respuestas.b: The command's output is executed by the shell
respuestas.c: The command's is run in background of the current shell
respuestas.d: The command's input is read from /dev/null
respuestas.e: The command's output is redirected to /dev/null

respuestas.a: It makes the contents of one directory available in another directory
respuestas.b: It mounts all available filesystems to the current directory
respuestas.c: It mounts all user mountable filesystems to the user's home directory
respuestas.d: It mounts all file systems listed in /etc/fstab which have the option userbind set
respuestas.e: It permanently mounts a regular file to a directory

test.enunciado:
Consider the following directory:
drwxrwxr-x 2 root sales 4096 Jan 1 15:21 sales
Which command ensures new files created within the directory sales are owned by the group sales? (Choose two.)
In order to display all currently mounted filesystems, which of the following commands could be used? (Choose two.)
Which chown command changes the ownership to dave and the group to staff on a file named data.txt?
When considering the use of hard links, what are valid reasons not to use hard links?

respuestas.a: Hard links are not available on all Linux systems because traditional filesystems, such as ext4, do not support them
respuestas.b: Each hard link has individual ownership, permissions and ACLs which can lead to unintended disclosure of file content
respuestas.c: Hard links are specific to one filesystem and cannot point to files on another filesystem
respuestas.d: If users other than root should be able to create hard links, suln has to be installed and configured
respuestas.e: When a hard linked file is changed, a copy of the file is created and consumes additional space

test.enunciado: Which daemon handles power management events on a Linux system?
Which of the following statements are true about the boot sequence of a PC using a BIOS? (Choose two.)

respuestas.a: Some parts of the boot process can be configured from the BIOS
respuestas.b: Linux does not require the assistance of the BIOS to boot a computer
respuestas.c: The BIOS boot process starts only if secondary storage, such as the hard disk, is functional
respuestas.d: The BIOS initiates the boot process after turning the computer on
respuestas.e: The BIOS is started by loading hardware drivers from secondary storage, such as the hard disk

test.enunciado: What is true regarding UEFI firmware? (Choose two.)

respuestas.a: It can read and interpret partition tables
respuestas.b: It can use and read certain file systems
respuestas.c: It stores its entire configuration on the /boot/ partition
respuestas.d: It is stored in a special area within the GPT metadata
respuestas.e: It is loaded from a fixed boot disk position

test.enunciado: When is the content of the kernel ring buffer reset? (Choose two.)

respuestas.a: When the ring buffer is explicitly reset using the command dmesg --clear
respuestas.b: When the ring buffer is read using dmesg without any additional parameters
respuestas.c: When a configurable amount of time, 15 minutes by default, has passed
respuestas.d: When the kernel loads a previously unloaded kernel module
respuestas.e: When the system is shut down or rebooted

respuestas.A: MBR can handle partition sizes up to 4 TB, whereas GPT supports partition sizes up to 128 ZB.
respuestas.B: By default, GPT can manage up to 128 partitions while MBR only supports four primary partitions.
respuestas.C: By default, GPT can manage up to 64 partitions while MBR only supports 16 primary partitions.

When booting from the hard disk, a computer successfully loads the Linux kernel and initramfs but hangs during the subsequent startup tasks. respuestas.A: Using the dmesg command from the rescue CD's shell to view the original system's boot logs.
respuestas.B: Investigating the file /proc/kmsg on the computer's hard disk for possible errors.

respuestas.B: Using modinfo -k followed by the name of the offending module.
respuestas.C: Using modprobe -r followed by the name of the offending module.
respuestas.D: Adding a blacklist line including the name of the offending module to the file /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf.
respuestas.E: Deleting the kernel module's directory from the file system and recompiling the kernel, including its modules.
